intro: Trapa manshurica f. komarovii, commonly known as the Komarovii water chestnut, is a rare aquatic plant native to the freshwater ecosystems of eastern Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, floating fruits that contain the seeds. The plant typically grows in shallow waters, where its broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves provide a habitat for various aquatic organisms. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical and ecological studies.
